body.p: Suppose also that TC has issued share options as remuneration to its employees. The share options are classified as equity and are vested at the acquisition date. They do not represent present ownership interest and do not entitle their holders to a proportionate share of TC’s net assets in the event of liquidation. The market‑based measure of the share options in accordance with IFRS 2 Share‑based Payment at the acquisition date is CU200. The share options do not expire on the acquisition date and AC does not replace them.
